name: Kepler-274
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-274 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-274 is a star with 0.9620000000000001 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.01 times its radius. It is located 4518.92 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-274 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-274 b

Kepler-274 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 11.63 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-274.

The mass of Kepler-274 b is 2.69 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-274 b is 1.54 that of Earth. At 2.69 Earth masses, Kepler-274 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-274 c

Kepler-274 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.20 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 33.20 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-274.

The mass of Kepler-274 c is 4.15 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-274 c is 1.84 that of Earth. At 4.15 Earth masses, Kepler-274 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-274, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
